risks.Risk Description: A pervasive concern in organizations, with 78% of respondents rating cybersecurity as high or very high risk.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Technology drives the top three highest risk areas, including cybersecurity.

risks.Risk Indicator: 78% of respondents rate cybersecurity as high or very high risk.

risks.Risk Description: Risk associated with information technology, identified as one of the top three highest risk areas.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Technology is a common underlying factor driving IT risk.

Contextual Variations: Publicly traded organizations rate IT risk lower compared to financial services.

risks.Risk Description: Rated as the third highest risk area, yet audits occur less frequently with only 58% of functions auditing it at least every 5 years.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Third parties are often used for IT services, contributing to the elevated risk level.

risks.Risk Indicator: 33 percentage point gap between perceived risk and audit frequency; only 58% conduct audits at least every 5 years.
Contextual Variations: Publicly traded organizations rate third-party relationships risk lower compared to financial services.

risks.Risk Description: A risk area with a higher perceived level—especially for nonprofit organizations—with a 24 percentage point gap between risk rating and audit frequency.
risks.Risk Indicator: 24 percentage point gap between risk perception and audit frequency.
Contextual Variations: Nonprofit organizations exhibit a much higher risk level for cost/expense reduction compared to other sectors.

risks.Risk Description: A risk area where concerns about governance and culture exist but the audit frequency is 20 percentage points lower than the perceived risk.
risks.Risk Indicator: 20 percentage point gap between perceived risk and audit frequency.

risks.Risk Description: Risk related to financial reporting and internal controls over financial reporting, influenced by SOX requirements; in publicly traded organizations, allocation to this risk decreased for the first time in three years.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) requirements drive the focus on financial reporting risk.

risks.Trend: Decreased allocation in publicly traded organizations for the first time in three years.
risks.Risk Indicator: 15 percentage point gap between audit frequency and risk rating, with marked differences based on SOX implementation.
Contextual Variations: Financial reporting risk is more pronounced in organizations with SOX implementation, notably differing between publicly traded and privately held sectors.

risks.Risk Description: A key risk area with almost 90% of respondents integrating fraud considerations into their audits and many CAEs being responsible for fraud investigations.
